greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of nonempty subsets of divisors of n.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Wasin So, Integral circulant graphs, Discr. Math. 306 (1) (2006) 153-158
formula: a(n) = -1 + 2^tau(n), where tau(n) = DivisorSigma(0, n) = A000005(n).
example: For all prime numbers p, a(p)=3, since those subsets are {{1,p},{1},{p}}.
maple: A100587:=n->-1+2^numtheory[tau](n): seq(A100587(n), n=1..100); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Dec 12 2015
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Dec 01 2004
